title: Priority Fulfillment Is Redefining DTC Logistics for High-Growth Brands
description: As traditional Third Party Logistics (3PL) firms continue to adapt too slowly, Priority Fulfillment has quietly reinvented the logistics playbook, emerging as a mission-critical infrastructure partner for countless of the fastest growing DTC and Amazon brands.
content:
Logistics has become the differentiator for successful direct-to-consumer (DTC) brands looking to drive sustainable growth and long-term profit in the ever-changing world of e-commerce. As traditional Third Party Logistics (3PL) firms continue to adapt too slowly, Priority Fulfillment has quietly reinvented the logistics playbook, emerging as a mission-critical infrastructure partner for countless of the fastest growing DTC and Amazon brands.

Established by e-commerce entrepreneur Marc Furmanski, Priority Fulfillment was born out of a need for a to solve the recurring problem faced by Furmanski and his peers. Furmanski, who prides himself on his logical, data-driven style, spent months meticulously creating Priority Fulfillment, with the goal of addressing operational gaps, including missed service-level agreements, subpar Amazon prep abilities, generic warehouse services, and a lack of visibility into inventory. You use tech, you strive for operational excellence, and Priority Fulfillment has already outperformed conventional (post and parcel) logistics services.

Furmanski's track record speaks volumes. From the early days of e-commerce in 2001, he focused on analyzing and reacting to consumer trends and the latest e-commerce trends. By 2017, following years of thriving entrepreneurial ventures—including his contribution to the commanding expansion and acquisition of Dream Products—Furmanski had forged his path as a trusted pioneer who could make ordinary consumer items best-sellers.

This know-how is at the heart of Priority Fulfillment's value proposition today. The company uses a robust inventory management software designed specifically to meet Amazon's and other online marketplaces' strict requirements. This enables brands to have a real-time view of their products throughout the product life cycle, from inbound warehousing to outbound final mile delivery, leading to improved order accuracy, inventory management, and customer satisfaction.

Along came Paul Farago, the veteran DTC strategist and luxury footwear entrepreneur, who partnered with Furmanski to solidify Priority Fulfillment's place in the market. Farago adds to the team over 20 years of direct experience in logistics, sourcing, distribution, and brand building. His past experience is impressive; after spending years at Kinderland managing luxury shoe distribution for brands including Giorgio Armani and Dolce & Gabbana, Farago launched Ace Marks in 2016. The Ace Marks campaign became the most funded shoe campaign in crowdfunding history, amassing over $3.5 million from three Kickstarter campaigns.

Farago's achievements at Ace Marks were not a result of innovative crowdfunding approaches alone, nor were they due to decadent Italian craftsmanship. Rather, he has depended heavily on effective logistics, world-class inventory management, and intelligent operational decisions—pieces that Priority Fulfillment has in place. His experience during the pandemic taught him how important robust logistical capabilities were to the resilience and growth of a brand. While so many peers stumbled, Ace Marks soared—positioning itself to buy rival brands, such as venture capital-backed Jack Erwin.

Understanding logistics as the primary bottleneck for growing and new brands, Farago recognised a great opportunity to work together with Furmanski and take advantage of what Priority Fulfillment has to offer. In 2023, Farago and Furmanski co-founded Octi Management, using Priority Fulfillment as a strategic center for their quickly growing portfolio that includes Underwear Station, which is a collective of 17+ underwear brands, and Myles Apparel.

"Logistics are the new bottleneck for brand growth," Farago says. "Priority Fulfillment created infrastructure, not hype. As others were chasing funding rounds, Priority Fulfillment quietly built a logistics machine and the results speak for themselves."

Priority Fulfillment's cautious expansion is a marked change of pace from the venture capital-inflated expansion common in recent years. The business deliberately skipped flagrant funding rounds and, instead, built a sound operational infrastructure on performance and customer referrals. It's a pragmatic stance, and part of Farago's broader philosophy that sustainable digital brands must be operationally efficient and profitable, rather than being propped up by an endless stream of venture cash.

The strategic breakthrough of Priority Fulfillment's expansion coincides with larger market movements. "Post-pandemic, the DTC landscape has shifted from Growth-at-Any-Cost toward a healthy margin-based business model." Brands are seeing that fulfillment is not just a cost center but also a key strategic asset. Priority Fulfillment's transparent systems & infrastructure, and focus on cutting-edge tech & data analytics—combined with an offensive approach toward accuracy and shipping times—make it the perfect partner for brands looking to make the jump to the profit-driven model.

Additionally, tech is now how Priority Fulfillment is staying competitive. Its software improves operational efficiency and delivers integration with major e-commerce ecosystems for brands that are operating in the midst of a complex, multi-channel, and multi-location world. Whether it's complex kitting, marketplace-specific requirements, or expedited shipments to Amazon DCs, Priority Fulfillment always delivers with unprecedented speed and flexibility.

Priority Fulfillment's success stories underscore why it stands apart in the logistics space. Brands partnering with Priority Fulfillment consistently report significant improvements in shipping speed, order accuracy, and real-time inventory visibility—all critical factors for customer satisfaction and sustained brand integrity.

The company's continued growth will be driven by Farago and Furmanski's combined strategic vision and operational expertise. As logistics become increasingly central to e-commerce success, Priority Fulfillment is strategically positioned to expand its service offerings and geographic reach.

"We're not growing for the sake of growth," says Farago. "Our mission is to build sustainable, highly efficient infrastructure to support brands committed to long-term success. We're addressing real-world logistical challenges, and that resonates deeply with today's leading DTC brands."

Ultimately, Priority Fulfillment is reshaping the DTC logistics landscape. In a market defined by constant disruption, the company provides brands not only with logistical solutions but with a clear path toward profitable, sustainable growth.

Priority Fulfillment isn't just redefining logistics—it's becoming an essential strategic partner for the next generation of direct-to-consumer brands.

What Is 3PL?
Third-party logistics (3PL) means outsourcing fulfillment operations to a logistics provider that manages the storage, packing and shipping of customer orders. A 3PL company handles logistics operations such as inventory storage, order fulfillment, shipping logistics, reverse logistics and returns processing for you.
Priority Fulfillment is a third-party fulfillment company built for ecommerce businesses that want to scale efficiently while delivering a great customer experience. Whether you’re fulfilling orders from your online store or multiple sales channels, our 3PL warehouse makes it seamless.
Why Choose Us as Your 3PL Provider?
Strategic Fulfillment Center Location
Our South Florida 3PL warehouse is 2-day ground shipping to 94% of US households, reducing shipping costs and delivery time.
Full-Service Logistics Partner
We handle the entire fulfillment process—from storing inventory and fulfilling orders to managing returns and optimizing carrier costs.
Ecommerce Platform Integrations
We integrate with Shopify, WooCommerce, Amazon, BigCommerce and 100+ other ecommerce platforms to automate fulfillment.
Data-Driven Fulfillment Operations
Our warehouse management software gives you live visibility into warehouse operations, order fulfillment status and inventory turnover.
No Shrinkage Guarantee
We back our inventory management systems with a zero-shrinkage policy—you’ll never pay for lost or unaccounted inventory.
Human Support with Real Expertise
Talk to experienced fulfillment specialists, not bots. We know the logistics industry and act as an extension of your operations team.
3PL FAQs
What is a 3PL?
A 3PL (third-party logistics) company handles your warehousing, inventory management, order fulfillment, shipping and returns — so you don’t have to. It’s a turnkey logistics partner that integrates directly into your supply chain.

argos_summary: Priority Fulfillment, co-founded by Marc Furmanski and Paul Farago, is revolutionizing logistics for direct-to-consumer (DTC) brands by providing a robust infrastructure that addresses common operational challenges in e-commerce. The company leverages advanced inventory management software to enhance order accuracy and customer satisfaction, positioning itself as a critical partner for brands seeking sustainable growth. With a focus on operational efficiency over venture capital-driven expansion, Priority Fulfillment is reshaping the logistics landscape to support brands in achieving long-term profitability.
